utilitarianism.rationale: Higher accuracy suggests potential to save more lives by optimizing resource allocation. Requires ongoing validation to ensure real-world harm reduction.

deontology.rationale: Opaque decisions violate transparency and accountability duties. Permit only with human oversight, appeal mechanisms, and consent protocols to respect autonomy.

virtue_ethics.rationale: Must augment clinician prudence and humility, not replace judgment. Require mandatory case reviews and accountability for model-informed decisions.

care_ethics.rationale: Permit if model preserves clinician-patient relationships and equitable access. Prevent depersonalization through continuous human engagement and bias checks.

counterargument.claim: Accuracy drift in dynamic ICU environments may cause lethal misallocations unseen in retrospective data.
counterargument.test: Parallel shadow-mode deployment with mortality/disparity tracking before full integration.
